description: This is my favorite chipotle I've ever been too! They have the friendliest nicest staff, and they do a great job making the food neatly. The ladies who work the Friday morning shift are hilarious and SO nice. Thank you for making our morning ladies!
author: Cara N.

description:
This isn't my favorite Chipotle, it just gets the job done because it's close to me proximity wise.

I ordered a steak burrito bowl. The brown rice was out and the girl was seriously going to scoop the crusty dry bits and pieces for me from the container, I didn't want burnt rice so I opted for the white rice which ended up being mushy.

The steak was really dry and didn't have that typical Chipotle juicy steak charbroiled flavored. I felt like I was chewing a dry erase marker. 

Also not sure why but this location seems to have smaller ingredient containers than the other locations. You'd think they would have bigger circumferences for the main stapes like the rice, beans, and salad but nope they're all of equal size which I'm assuming makes things less efficient because you always have to replenish.
author: Connie M.

description:
What a bad experience. I went to this place to order a burrito. In the beginning I already could see that both, black and pinto beans, were from the night before. 
Ok. Not a huge deal there... but that was just the beginning. The lady making my burrito was not prepared at all for the job. 
I specifically asked for nothing spicy. I guess I was not heard because I couldn't finish my food from being too spicy!!! 
The burrito was very badly constructed and they charge you $2.45 for guac. The amount of guac was literally a 1/4 from an avocado. Probably less than that. 
Oh did I mentioned that the tortilla was uncooked? 
Yep... 
kinda of a lot for a simple burrito. 
Anyway. Not a place to return.
author: Leonardo A.

description:
Came here today with my friend. Went through the line and everything was ok, not stellar service but not horrible. 
Went and got a table and when she opened her burrito, it fell apart. The guy did a horrible wrapping job. So my friend went back up to the counter to ask for another one and the guy laughed and said he'd have to ask his manager. The manager came and gave her a new burrito but when she came and sat back down, there were two employees who were pointing and laughing at her (young Asian guy and young African American girl). When she looked at them, they were waving and pointing and kept laughing. So I'm seeing this, I went up to them to ask them their names and the African American girl (think her name is kaylen or something close to that) wouldn't tell me her name, scoffed at me and my friend and then walked away. The "manager" asked me what was wrong and I told him and he was like "I was watching them the whole time, they did nothing wrong". Like cmon dude... the whole restaurant saw this and you're blatantly lying to my face. Even the customers that were sitting down said we were right and saying them mocking her. I asked the "manager" what his employees names were and he said he didn't have to tell me. So I asked him what his name was, he said it was Vince. I told him I wanted to talk to someone higher up than him, so he gave me Edgar's card. Edgar is the only saving grace for this restaurant. I told him what happened and he was very gracias and apologetic on the phone... that's how customer service should be.  As for the other employees, learn how to treat your customers. They're only getting 2 stars because Edgar redeemed them a little bit.
author: Rachel A.

description:
I'm a corporate investor of Chipotle so I know the quality of the food prep and the methods of business transactions and how they are supposed to transpire. From beginning to end the experience at this location was unsatisfactory. From the cross contamination of using the same spoon to serve BOTH chicken & sofritas. 

Next was the checkout, upon where I stated to the host "RAVEN " that half / half was served without an extra charge. She replied with "That's your opinion. That isn't a half half, it is double portion" with a condescending tone. 

To anyone that enjoys this chain, I encourage you to realize that this particular location does NOT represent the entirety of Chipotle as a company. The execution (or lack thereof) of this particular locations food prep, transaction, and unsatisfactory customer service is appalling and surprising at the same time.
author: Kai H.

description:
This will be passed to CORPORATE office at Chipotle.

This event took place last night (1/11/2018) at San Francisco's Fisherman Wharf Chipotle location. However, after having visited so many Chipotle locations, it has been my experience that this issue is far and wide a problem at Chipotle restaurants.

Here the story: 

Chipotle, San Francisco Fisherman Wharf, 1/11/2018 - 

I ordered a Burrito and a Bowl. The person serving at the counter asked the typical question about which rice type I would have liked on my order. I asked for white rice. 
The first problem was that there was NOT rice left in the container and he literally scraped from the bottom and sides all that he could gather from what was left, then placed this rice on my orders; not appealing. 

I asked: "Don't you have fresh rice?"
Answer: "we are making new rice, then he looked at me without saying a word for few seconds after which he muttered, what meat?"

Perhaps this person should have ask me to hold on so that they could replace the rice container with a new batch of rice, assuming that Chipotle keeps its ingredients ready to be replaced. Not sure at this location, but I decided to overlook this issue.

I asked for Barbacoa on the burrito. The server placed about a table spoon size of meat on it, perhaps 1 once of it. Seriously, I looked at him and asked him if he thinks that is the correct portion of meat serving. He just looked at me , again for few seconds, and said: "Nothing else"?.... 

I repeated the question about the meat portion size, and I added: "Can you add more meat to this order, because it is obviously not enough, it does not seems right".
Since this guy may have been either smoked, drunk, utterly clueless, or just stared working at Chipotle, a co-worker of his responded to me in his behalf: 
"If you want more meat, cost more money... you have to pay extra".

Well, that is fair if the initial portion was what you are entitled with your initial purchase, but this was not the case, of course in my honest opinion.

I argued with this other employee, that the amount of meat served could not have been correct, at which she responded: "This is our portion size, 4 once of meat".
I was laughable since first, this person obviously does not know what 4 ounces of meat may look like (1/4 of pound) and second, the employeee that was originally taking the order did not weight the portion (they do not do that at Chipotle) but just placed an arbitrary amount on top of the rice. 

I asked: "Do you think that meat on the burrito is 4 ounces"?
Answer: "yes, is our standard size"

Again, I must have ordered in my lifetime maybe 100 burritos at Chipotle, and never had a discussion about meat, or for any other matter with an employee there. Although it is never scientific the amount of meat they place on their burrito (it is arbitrary, at the discretion of the server) it is somewhat reasonable at eye sight, albeit never the same.
In this case, it was so ludicrous the amount of serving they provided me, that I could not have said nothing.

Anyway, getting back to the event, to her answer ("yes, is our standard size"), I replied: "why do not you go and weight the meat on this burrito".

At this point she went in the back of the kitchen, and presumably when to talk to some one over there.

They never weighted the meat, nor they reasonably looked at the order and properly added meat to correct the portion (which I think it was by far the most reasonable thing to do, than argue with a client). Rather, these 20-21 years old kids gang together like I was a fool, and that they could care less. Obviously I did not complete my purchase and refused my order.



To Chipotle Corporate: You are a disgrace to have a store be ran like that. Perhaps the touristic location of this restaurant let you care less of this customer base, but the whole serving process, and attitude of your employess, I hope will contribute to the natural FAILURE of all your chain.

Once you have poisoned your customers, then used GMO, then you can not even provide consistency with your food.

NOT GOOD BUSINESS!
author: C B.

description: Went to this place during last weekend The place is close to fisherman wharf so was convenient to get something to eat . We ordered a bowl of white rice and toppings. They charge additional for some toppings. I understand the price at this location but for the price the quantity seemed too less. You need to probably order two bowls to get a filling meal
author: Satish R.

description: Bad experience at this chipotle branch.. The beans were very salty and the steak was really dry and old. I have eaten at other chipotles many many times, but this one was really terrible. Also the waitress with the tattoo and node ring was rude and looked like she was forced to work. Hope management does something about this branch.
author: Abhishek P.

description: This is my chicken bowl with everything. This place is great for a quick bite if you are on the go. The food is delicious and always fresh. The manager Mel here is very nice and the workers are wonderful. The workers that helped me were Christine and Glen. They were very nice and got everything to my liking. This place is amazing and would recommend this place to any one looking for tasty burrito or some tacos.
author: David Z.

description: I used to love ordering burritos but after my visit here I ONLY get burrito bowls. The person making my burrito overstuffed it and made a huge hole in the bottom. We both saw it but nothing was done about it. When I went to eat it all the stuff came out the bottom and onto the table.
author: Joe A.

description: Shitty even by chipotle standards. Food is routinely out of stock or cold, drink machine broke or out of ice.  As if that wasn't bad enough the staff is either not empowered to fix things or don't care.  Shittiest of shitty shit places.
author: Chris S.

description: Chipotle use to be a descent place to eat.... they are mediocre at best.  The food isn't the same nor is the dressing that I use to get for the salad... thank God they lightened up on the chips with the lime....it was way bad.... not sure if I'll go back if so everything will have to be fresh.... the chicken was dry snd the initial serving was slight.  Didn't enjoy it and cost too much especially when ordering the avocado... at least 3-$4.00 over priced.  The help not that attentive.
author: Kathy W.

description: What a disgusting location.  The Staff was rude, tables and floors dirty.  The steak was gross...reminded me of overcooked beef liver flavor.  I'm not a fan of Chipotle usually and this store reminded me of just that.
author: Christa M.

description: I got food poisoning.  Yacked way too many times from the chicken burrito bowl. I am shook!
author: Celine L.

description:
The food was good, thanks for not giving us silverware  so we wouldn't have to eat our burritos like savages in our hotel room! Cheers mate!!
   Asshats
author: Mike P.

description:
When you make a mistake you shouldn't use a napkins to wipe off the mistake on the tortilla.  When you ask to speak the manager and get what's left of Vince who comes out like a pitbull ready to hump your leg cause he's had a bad day then pointing out the issue is lost on his 5 foot 4 inch ass then I'm lost for how he can manage anything more less a Chipotle.  

Making an ass of yourself as an manager only goes to show he shouldn't be managing.   Given he's the size of a chihuahua perhaps his next gig will be Taco Bell.  

Lost: One 5 foot 4 chihuahua who goes by the name Vince.  If found please return to Taco Bell but do not make eye contact or question his ability.   Until found avoid this Chipotles in the hopes they learn how to make food in a sanitary way and if they can't they at least have a manager that can take constructive criticism without making an ass of himself.
author: Marc Lee R.

description: soooooooo bummed out as a chipotle fan to have to leave such a shitty review. HORRIBLE experience. The portions were wack, the rice is super crunchy & the worst part is the customer service was painful. Raven was condescending & was the cherry on top for me writing this review. As a gluten free empath vegetarian my food options are minimum and sucks to have to cross this off my list of places that I can sit recharge and enjoy a meal.
author: Haley H.

description: I came here from Los Angeles with my family, and tonight is our last night in SF so we decided to stop by Pier 39 to eat. Everything was expensive we we were planning to go to In N Out, but the like was insanely long so we decided to get chipotle since it was right down the street. I work at a place similar to chipotle but with Korean food called Bibigo, and the way it runs is just the same as chipotle. What I've learned from working in a chain restaurant like this is that you must have outstanding customer service. The workers must make the guests feel welcomed because it's the customers who allow the workers to have a job. Right as soon as it was my turn to make an order, the girl approached my dad and I with a frown and asked us what we wanted, but her tone and attitude sounded like she didn't give a shit about us. So I just made my usual order of a bowl with white rice, no beans, chicken, veggies, 3 scoops of corn, cheese, and lettuce. As soon as I asked for 3 scoops of corn, the Asian girl gave me a dirty look and then looked at the first girl who took my order, and the put 3 small scoops of corn in my bowl with a disgusting attitude. Then as soon as we got to the cashier, the guy there with glasses rang us up at the register, but there was a frown on his face and he seemed so done with everything. The food was actually good, but they ran out water and spoons and forks, so they just didn't even care about their restaurant. Would not recommend going to this chipotle location.
author: Julie L.

description:
Very very disappointed with how the employees and more specifically the manage handled this situation. 

I arrived with my wife and 7 year old son at 9:40pn. After being in line for over 10 minutes we finally ordered. The girl making the food asked "for here or to go?" I said we would be eating in. The food was completed, I paid we got our drinks and sat down. After about 5 minutes, one of the stores employees comes up to our table and all the other tables that had people eating and rudely said "we are closed now and you have to leave". 

You mean to tell me I just spent 30 dollars on food to be kicked out? If I would have known that I would be kicked out, I would of never ordered food from there. I asked to speak to the manager and told him my situation. I told him I would like a refund as this was very unprofessional to kick someone out when they are in the middle of eating. His response was "you already finished your food". After I pointed to my wife walking out the door with ALL of our food he said "I'll give you 5 minutes to finish. I said this is absolutely ridiculous and very unprofessional of you and your staff. The option to eat in should of never been offered, as I would of found some other place to eat at if I'd know my family and I would get kicked out. As I was walking back to Pier 39 we realized that McDonalds had their doors locked but guest were still enjoying their food inside without being kicked out like we were from Chipotle. Very upsetting.
author: Amy W.

description:
First off i love chipotle out of all the restaurants like in and out & subway that were nearby I chose to eat here cus im a chipotle freak

This location is so bad! The cashier was so rude i had to ask for a bag even though its for to go! Didnt even say hi or anything& she was in a hurry! I ordered the burrito bowl & it was so gross the steak tasted old & had a gross texture to it.. I usually finish my food from there so fast but i threw half my plate away
author: Mecca D.

description: Didn't get to eat here to do a true review. Why? because they only had 2 bowls, 4 taco shells (despite the whole package next to her that was unopened), and 0 burrito tortillas left. Maybe it's true but considering the lady at the counter at first wouldn't acknowledge us because she was wiping down the counter and then gave me a look like "really?" When me and my family came in, my assumption is it's because they wanted to close and really didn't want to serve us. I find it hard to believe a burrito place ran out of tortillas.   Passed by again half an hour before closing and they're putting up all the chairs WHILE people are still sitting and eating! To me, that's incredibly rude service regardless.
author: Kelsey K.

description: Slower than the pregnancy of a full grown elephant. I could of read the Iliad in the line. Do not go here unless you have nothing to do.
author: Frank M.

description: I'll start by saying that I LOVE Chipolte... Like seriously. But I'm from New York City... And I can say without doubt ours are 100x better in terms of quality and service than west coast. This staff was SO slow, easily distracted... The food was cold, the portion sizes were smaller than usual... Really terrible. I hate to say this as a chipotle advocate, but damn.... Hope they fix this up!
author: Caty P.

description: Do you love Chipolt-ay? Great! Go to another location, unless you want to get swarmed by tourists and receive a pathetically sized burrito/bowl that would disappoint even your inner anorexic. I mean it wasn't bad, but I've had bigger *insert lenny face*.
author: Sameer C.

description: I was a bit disappointed when they messed up my burrito bowl order, but more than made up for it when they replaced it for free. The gentleman at the checkout was very accommodating. Unfortunately, they did run out of ingredients quite a bit during our visit, but high traffic areas are hard to manage anywhere. I would return for the friendly cashier.
author: Porsche P.

description:
Second time in this location. Not a fan of any Chipotle, but I work in the area and a girls gotta eat! 
The first thing I notice was how clean and organized the place looks. 
Both times I order bowls. 1 with carnitas, another with tofu (new years resolution: less meat!) Not bad, not really Mexican either.
Joseph at the register was super sweet and friendly, so I'm writing this review mainly because of the customer service. 
 If you are hungry with little time, and are sick of the clam chowder in the bread bowl and In & Out tasteless burgers, go here.
author: Jessica E.

description: I love chipotle.  Not here. Girl making food was rushed, rude. Skimpy burritos.  Small.small. place. We walked past here many times today it was full. While eating noticed a sign that says maximum capacity was 47.
author: B L.

description: Ate here on 6/15/2016. Thought I'd give chipotle another chance since I haven't heard of any food poisoning cases in awhile. I was WAY WRONG! Group of 4, 2 got the barbacoa burritos and me and the other opted for steak burritos. The rice was cold in all of our burritos and the guacamole was soupy. The 2 that had barbacoa now have food poisoning and us that had steak are a little better but still running to the bathroom every 20 minutes. Worse chipotle I've ever been too. Would give 0 stars of it would let me. Also when rolling my burrito he broke the tortilla twice.
author: Mariah A.

description: This restaurant employed the most stingy employees. I ordered a steak salad bowl. I told them I wanted nothing but rice, steak and  hot salsa only. They seemed to measure everything but the bowl was only a little more than quarter full ??????? Wth ... I told them I actually need more rice and they did not even respond but rolled their eyes ???? What kind of response was that ?????? Hey Chipotle ???? That was very rude of your employees ... ??? I did not want anything but rice, hot salsa and steak ???? What was the issue ???? I did not understand ... Not returning !
author: Annie L.

description:
Just got back from Chipotle.. went in when it wasn't too crowded and they were already out of carnitas, Barbacoa and steak... it's a Saturday, and you're an hour from closing?! Also pretty small proportions. 

I go to this one because it's the closest and the burrito sizes are never the same. sometimes I pay $8 for a $4 burrito and $8 for a $10! it doesn't make sense... wouldn't recommend this place. :(
author: Ali F.

description:
Cut to the chase: My bowl was so empty it could've had a flat lid!

Long version:
Ok before I go off, three nice things that gave this place an extra star: The lines are short, the place is clean, and the manager is nice even though he has to deal with a bunch of punks. Maybe the workers suck so bad no one wants to go here which keeps the lines short, which results in a clean store. The extra star is just for the manager then.

Three of us went in today and they skimped on every bit of the process except the tortillas, which would be impossible to minimize. I was going to ask for half carnitas and sofritas but the girl gave me a stank look after she scooped a 'full' portion of carnitas she just passed it along. Their definition of full is equivalent to the size of 2-3 chicken McNuggets, enough for a toddler maybe.

They were running low on rice so instead of doing their jobs and bringing more out, they split about 2 servings into 5 (we took some orders to go as well). When you ask for more rice, they will practically count each grain. 'More guac' (after a shady ass 1/4 spoonful) to them means to give about the size of how much toothpaste you'd put on your brush. After seeing the anemic portions, the manager insisted the workers give more of whatever we wanted, so I asked for sofritas. She gave me about 1/4 of a spoonful and passed it on, then the other girl tried charging me for it! I would've walked out but the manager pretty much forced her against her will to hook it up. My bowl was still not full enough to need a 3-dimensional lid but I just don't have much patience to deal with dumb people.

My co-worker was so scared that I had to go up and ask for a salsa to go for her. It's one of those places where anything you ask for you'll either get the absolute minimum, or a dirty ass look, or both. They make you repeat everything as if you're ordering in Spanish. The workers are so shady it seems like they wake up early to slaughter their own animals, pick their own vegetables and cook one grain of rice at a time.

I would be a little more sympathetic if this wasn't some giant conglomerate that makes billions of dollars per year. I'm serious, they made $2.7 billion last year, so it makes no sense why they're so shady with their portions. There was no one else in line! They rushed us as if the President was waiting, twiddling his thumbs after us.

Oh, worst of all, my friend found two bones in a burrito bowl. One of them looked like a petrified piece of asparagus, or maybe a chicken's toe? Something disgusting.

If you go here, be prepared to eat two bananas to make up for the food that should've filled the lid.
author: Eric C.

description:
Ugh. I just ate a steak burrito from this Chipotle location. (brown rice, black beans, cheese, guacamole, medium salsa) and it was easily the worst burrito I've eaten in 20 years. Admittedly, someone who chooses Chipotle in a town with so many other local burrito options has no real reason complaining about the food, I happened to be near the Wharf and wanted something quick, consistent and reliable. 

The steak was of the lowest grade imaginable and was completely undercooked -- to the point of causing alarm. The burrito was wrapped into the shape of a deflated volleyball, but what can you expect from a fast-food worker who doesn't see burritos as an "aspirational vocation?" -- and all for nearly 11 dollars. That's what I'd expect to pay for a high-quality "artisan" burrito anywhere else in the city, resulting in a 5-star rating. 

Other than that, it was a very clean location, and Chipotle's signage, decor, staff and appointments are all as charming and adequate as I've come to expect. 

I'm generally down with Chipotle as a "fast-food" option in a pinch, but you have no idea what you're going to get when you patronize the location on Fisherman's Wharf. With so many other food options located less than a block or two from this restaurant, please take your business somewhere else so that Chipotle's corporate managers shutter this one.
author: West R.

description: Bad customer service. The only burrito maker present made me wait while she did an online order which I didn't mind, but then I noticed that she didn't have brown rice or veggies ready. When asked for veggies she told me there's none and that she'd have to make them, I said that's okay fine and I can wait, then she got in an attitude and kind of threw her hands up and called back for veggies to be made. At that point I was too annoyed and didn't want to wait any longer so I told her nevermind and she continued to give me attitude even though she didn't even start my order yet. I understand that I could have come in after rush hour or something and maybe that's why they werent prepared, but she didn't need to give me attitude like she did. As if I was asking her to go out of her way for me.
author: Elliott S.

description: I love Chipotle but this one annoyed me.  We were there late in the evening and they skimped on absolutely everything.  I had a bowl and the ingredients didn't even fill it.
author: Abigail F.

description: Big fan of Chipotle, but not a fan this place.    My jaw dropped at just how stingy the portions were.  Asking for more beans in my Carnitas Bowl garnered me about 3 more beans.   Even my 8 year old who ordered a regular Carnitas Bowl was telling me he was still hungry afterward.    Unbelievable.
author: Matt F.

description: Been to several chipotle's but this one wasn't as good as the others I've been to.. I ordered a bowl and they served a very little portion of rice and beans. The fajitas had a burnt taste which I haven't felt at other ones I've been to.. They can definitely do better!
author: Makshita L.

description: This place was amazing!!! Food was fresh and the service was equally awesome. I'm not sure why it had such poor review but would highly recommend this place. Thanks Katie and the staff for a great dining experience :)
author: Miji V.

description:
I'm not sure what some of these people are complaining about. I eat at this chipotle almost every other day and I've never enjoyed such hospitality in a fast food restaurant. The staff is always overwhelmingly happy to see me, and they treat me like family. Most of the time Stephanie will draw a smiley face on my burrito. 
In a place like this, the food is whatever the food is, there not a lot that the staff can do to make it any different. What they can do is give an elevated level of customer service, and that's exactly what they do at this Chipotle.
author: Brian C.

description:
I wouldn't even give half a star to this place and wouldn't go back ever. I order a vege bowl which costs around 7$ before starting the bowl the employee didn't bother to tell me she was out of Hot Sauce, Tomato mixture, corns, and bell peppers and onion mixture. Out of 8 or 9 things that's vege bowl has they didn't have half of them. I still agreed to buy it and just told her to add some more guacamole in place of the missing stuff and the manager showed up and wanted to charge me for that. That lady should go back to school to learn basic manners and customer service  lessons. If you don't have 4/9 items did I ask you for discount. With all due respect I know how retail industry works as I have served at Starbucks for 2 years. 

That wasn't the end, it was 10pm and she yelled at people saying that we should leave within 5 mins as store is closed. After 5 mins she turned the volume high up as she was making it a clubbing spot. This was all because she wanted us to leave. This is not how chipotle is. So it's a request to manager pl not to spoil image of chipotle. Show some respect to customer.
author: Pooja J.

description: Shoutout to this Chipotle for comping my lunch because they ran out of chicken! Wasn't expecting it and thought it was very generous of them. Top notch customer service from this location.
author: Alexis P.

description: Came here at lunchtime to redeem the coupon for the free burrito giveaway after the national Chipotle meeting as a result of the E.coli outbreak.  Line staff was friendly and eager to assist. Got the chicken burrito bowl.  Everything seemed decently fresh.  Guacamole had nice chunks of avocado. My biggest complaint is that the brown rice might have been a little undercooked...but overall standard chipotle fare.
author: Catherine A.

description:
Apparently it's my job to greet the staff when I walk in. Don't stare at me with a blank face and say nothing. That's really poor customer service and a poor attitude. If you think you are too good to work there, then you need to get on with your life girl. There are people who would be grateful to have a job, and make the most of it no matter what. I know because I worked in customer service on that block for 3 years. I know it's hard and you have bad days, but your attitude is up to you. Don't make people feel unwelcome by being lazy and emo. Needless to say I walked out, and I probably won't come back. 

Ps: Star is always really awesome and friendly. If you need a role model, just watch her shine. You go Star!
author: Aaron H.

description:
Solid Chipotle location in Fisherman's Wharf. The restaurant is very clean from the times I have came here and I have yet to be disappointed. Service here is very quick and the employees here look very eager to help out the customer. 

Definitely deserving of 5 stars, keep up the good work!
author: Sam K.

description:
Echoing some other people... Chipotle is usually pretty good but this place seems off. 

They ran out of sour cream. 

I mean, sour cream. Can't you just run to Safeway and buy sour cream?

Doesn't seem like they are trying very hard, looking at the other reviews...
author: Kai S.

description:
Well now I know that Chipotle is not very good. Mission Accomplished!! A whole chain of restaurants I never have to go to. 

I just thought every ingredient in my vegetarian burrito was flavorless and/or cardboard like in texture. I ate it studying the calorie count thoughtfully provided for each item, and tried to add it all up but realized that nowhere on the board was the tortilla accounted for. Psych!

I'm not crazy about the idea that beans are often cooked in lard for that flavor that only fat can impart, but I'd take half the beans for four times the flavor any day. I'm sure that calorie formula works. Gordos and real Mission burritos here I come.
author: Gwynnie P.

description: It's as bad as everyone says. First there is a serious issue with cleanliness. The guy behind the counter was dragging his gloves (the ones that he wears to protect customers) all over the counter and touching pens and the register and other non food items. This is NOT sanitary and is in violation. Second, the sour cream had pieces of corn floating in it and salsa. Uh...that's a problem. Oh, the food just didn't look good. The staff behind the counter was not very polite. Never again.
author: Robin G.

description:
Some might say this isn't real Mexican food (and it probably isn't) but I don't care!!!  I love the burrito bowl that seems large enough to feed a small family :p

Americanised Mexican Chain food ftw!

Let it be known I also like Westernised Chinese food so don't shake your head at me for liking non authentic Mexican food.

Oh and I was the first one in the store so didn't have any issues with the wait, or the staff not making things properly.  Guess it helps going first though.
author: Angela Y.

description: Let me start by saying I could eat chipotle for dinner every night of the week, not here. This place is a sorry excuse for a chipotle. I have grabbed food to go for dinner a few times around 7:30 and the food has been cold every time and it takes me less then ten minutes to walk home. Horrible quality control. If I could give this place zero stars I would.
author: Sydney P.

description:
Worst dining experience of my life. Waited for 15 minutes with three people in front of me. When it was my turn they were out of rice, meat, and beans. Waited another 10 minutes. When I was frustrated the server decided she was going to "skip me" as I was frustrated. The place was filthy and the employees/manager were the rudest people I've ever met.  

I love chipotle but this place is a disgrace for the brand. Get a new staff or I'll never go back.
author: J P.

description: I ordered a salad, ate half at the restaurant and took the rest home.  When I went to eat it the following day, I found a clump of hair (it looked like as though it had been removed from a brush) in the salad.  It was not my color, etc.
author: Susan J.

description:
I honestly can't remember the last time I've eaten at McDonald's or Burger King-- many years at the very least-- just can't take their greasy, processed crap.  But for me, Chipotle is in a different league.  I actually like this chain -- they serve quality food (hormone free meats, some organic veggies, most everything cooked in house), and depending on your choices, healthy too.  

I came here tonight after a 6.2 mile run, exhausted, not really wanting to cook, and so I picked up a burrito bowl for a late dinner-- cilantro rice piled high with raw veggies, black beans, corn, salsa, lettuce and meat.  Mostly healthy, right?  And pretty delicious.  

No, Chipotle's and a Mission burrito aren't even comparable- it's obvious that the Mission wins out every time.  I have to say that for what they do serve, they definitely do it well.  So if you're nowhere near the Mission and wanting something in Fisherman's Wharf that's not deep fried or In-N-Out, then Chipotle really isn't a bad choice.  

Anyway, I'm so glad to have this place finally open in Fisherman's Wharf!  There are so few non-schlocky dining options in my immediate neighborhood that all of us here are pretty excited about the new addition.  It's located a couple of doors down from In-N-Out.
author: Joanne G.

description: Worst customer service ever ! Visited over the weekend on Saturday and the guy with the curly hair had the worst attitude . My nephews had never ate chipotle so id figure we eat here since they are not fans of seafood . When we went in the line was non existent we waited over the counter for a little and he was impatiently staring and I let him know they were not aware of what they had and he proceeded to roll his eyes . I can continue the review but the service I received doesn't even deserve one star . SUCH A BEAUTIFUL LOCATION BUT NEVER COMING BACK HERE AGAIN and to add yes the portions here are small compared to either chipotles
author: Jenn R.

description: So visiting The City on our way up to Humboldt. The kids & I decide on pizza.... Delish. The hub says eewww I'm getting Chipotle. NOT a good idea. At about 4 am it started. Has lasted all day as we were in and out of the hotel. I guess the salmanilritto is not a thing of the past.
author: D A.

description:
Just had lunch here. Without exception poor service from each person behind the counter, starting with the person who took my order to each person asking what I wanted. 

Complete contrast to my experiences at every other Chipotle I've been to. I love Chipotle but clearly this location has issues. Posting a review because this is not the first time I experienced poor service at this location. 

A real shame considering there are relatively few nutritious and reasonably priced food options at the Wharf.
author: sunit g.

description:
This chipotle pretty good. 
Place an online order and it was ready on time. Only thing was they forgot my small drink cup I ordered. No biggie the person got the cup when I reminded her. No hazel or anything
author: ipod t.

description:
Although chipotle is a franchise and all operate under the same business model and intention, not all chipotles are equal. 

The chipotle I'm at now is located in the heart of a popular tourist destination being Fisherman's Wharf. Despite the high volume of customers, this chipotle maintains its efficiency of time to complete the order. 

Additionally, the chipotle is kept very clean which I imagine could be difficult for a fast-food style restaurant. Sometimes chipotle's can smell like BO-body ordor because of the meat. This one does NOT smell. Everything on point. 

Storm, is a standout employee deserving recognition for her ability to manage the employees on the line and back of the house. I've become acquainted with Storm over the past couple years eating at this location. It makes the meal that much better when accompanied by an employee with great positive energy and happiness and often sharing jokes.
author: William H.

description: Moes destroys chipotle to begin with. I had to come to this shit hole of a place because there was no moes around. I was coming in with a positive attitude at first since it was my first time and I was hungry. There was no cheese or salsa and other food that is suppose to be at a Mexican grill food place. How the fuck do you run out of cheese though! The chicken was burnt too and everything tastes like shit. Best part of the meal was my water that was free....
author: Emily T.

description: The wife and I were down at fisherman's wharf, we decided we would  have Mexican food for lunch. We went to the Chipotle restaurant on Jefferson Street. The lines to get food were long but this to be expected during the pre  holidays. We finally got our food fround a place to sit  down and enjoy our meal. Now comes the  explanation on only three star rating, this must be authentic Mexican food because we spent the next two days on the toilet. Thanks for nothing Chipotle.
author: Dave L.

description: The most disturbing fast food meal I've ever had. I ordered a burrito stuffed with chewy cold chicken and hot slime-like veggies. I had no idea what was happening, but in order to extend my overall lifespan I tossed the football shaped garbage burrito in the trash and ran back to the hotel for a hot shower. Two weeks later and I still feel dirty. There's something very strange about the quality of food at this location compared to others, and I worry that I'll never be the same.
author: Kevin W.

description: I think the experience depends on the staff they day. I've generally had decent experiences at this location. Today wasn't very good. I asked for half steak half carnitas and got charged double  even when I asked for half. Secondly, the steak was rather gross today. I was bummed out. It was really fatty/chewy and unflavored. Next, I ordered guacamole (like I always do) and received a scoop of about a table spoon and a half. I don't see how an employee can be aware that a customer is paying $2 more for something and only give a tiny amount.  I had to ask for a better scoop. I'm only slightly annoyed because I had never had a problem with guacamole portions before. Next, I had a free reward from my chipotle card but the employee was unsure how to redeem it. I understand that they may have been new and I will be able to redeem the reward later. However, it was still inconvenient as I was planning on using it that day
author: Kelsey J.

description: The service and food has improved a lot. I come here often during my lunch break and love chipotle. Its really healthy compared to all the other places around the wharf.
author: Emily G.

description: Loved the steak burrito with white rice & beans, but most of all the make your own kid meal! Everything was delicious! Only bad thing is the soda machine was not working, forcing us to buy other more expensive drinks  Overall a good place to eat, even though the venue is a bit small & tough to find a seat, but then again this is San Francisco!
author: Rosa G.

description:
I went to Chipotle Mexican Grill last week, and the restaurant was full because of all the people who came there for the delicious food, fresh ingredients, and something healthy. 

 

The service is very special, because it is relaxing and you can make own your food. The atmosphere is very normal, typical of restaurant chain, but it is nice because you can see the ingredients and watch the preparation. When I went, I ordered two meat tacos and I requested all the fresh vegetables and other ingredients. In my opinion, it was delicious, because I love Mexican food.

 

This restaurant is famous for its food and prices because it is very cheap. It is ideal restaurant to come to with your family or friends when you want to have Mexican food.  Next time I go, I would like to have a burrito.
author: Andrea C.

description: I have experienced better but the manager, young girl that night didn't care about her job. I know how Chipotle works and they have to chop the lemons. I asked for them, the guy went back to check and said they didn't have anymore. The guy was busy and it looked like they were understaffed but then the manager walked in the front door and sat in the back with head phones on and didn't check a thing, like the condiments bar? She could have cut up the lemons and stocked the bar but I have seen this type of manager before. These stores can be bad because the volume from tourist business, they don't care and thats why I give them one star.
author: Dale T.

description:
I really dislike this place! This is the second time in my life I have tried Chipotle ...I thought I would give it one last go. I work around the corner and wanted some tacos. I wish I had taken a pic of the portion the woman put of Barbacoa in the taco, because it was so disproportionate to the size of the tortilla that I gave a big laugh out loud. 
I really could not believe she grabbed a tiny tiny smidge of meat with her tongs and even put some back as if she had put too much. She proceeded to add a big slab of cream as if to fill in the lack of meat. 
Never ...never again...
author: Sandra M.

description: I have been to a few Chipotle locations in the US. This one gotta be the worst. The cutie orange that came with the kids meal was mouldy.
author: Donia T.

description: Worst chipotle I've ever been to. The girl gives you half a spoon of meat.. She's probably new. Didn't know where the bowls were and didn't even bother looking for them. They were right under her..
author: Tiffany V.

description: Not Mexican food, a national chain of Tex Mex.  While the taco was filling it was just as un-special as all other locations even down here to Texas where people believe this ruse more.   Way better places to eat while in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
author: Greg D.

description:
I remember when I was really excited that Chipotle was opening right by my office. Been here twice since it opened, and both had some very "meh" meals here. I can't quite put my finger on it but it just doesn't taste as good as the other Chipotles I've been to. Something is off with this place.

Also the workers here can't wrap a burrito even if their life depended on it! The burrito always breaks. Fucking rookies. You have 3 simple tasks. Put the ingredients on the damn tortilla, wrap, and cash out. And no, I don't want a double wrap on my burrito. Why would I want to unnecessary consume an additional 400 calories from your tortilla? Anyways happened on both of my visits, and the second time I just wanted to ditch the food in front of the worker and walk out, but I was really craving a burrito so I didn't. But i would of done it... I really would of...
author: Charles L.

description: Great fast food, clean nice people, well priced in the middle of Fisherman's Warf
author: Alan R.

description: I would never begin to conceive that Chipotle was anything more than Americanized Mexican food. That said, I deem this particular store the worst of all the Chipotles I've been to. Reason #1: They ran out of the cardboard takeout containers. 2. They were out of the mild sauce. Like, not just for the time being. They were out for the evening. 3. My friend and I weren't hungry but we knew we needed to grab food at some point in the night, so we went to the most convenient place in the neighborhood. To feel adventurous,  we ordered from the "secret menu." Quesarito (burrito that was first grilled with cheese) and nachos were our choice.  Get this: they don't melt the cheese on the nachos. They said, "there's no way for us to do that." Really? Nachos is quite the misnomer for the dish, don't you think? The takeaway here is: secret menu is not always awesome.  Ordering off the Chipotle secret menu has been thus far 100% awful.
author: Lily T.

description:
I went there on the weekend and the line was quite long. The server tried to add lots of rice and beans and skimp on the meat like stated in other posts. I ordered a chicken burrito and the guy prepared a carnitas one without knowing the difference.  

The drink counter was very messy with soda spilled all over it. Just average overall.
author: Karl A.

description: no complaints. they move the line real fast. food is never cold and portions arent as short as most locations.
author: Alonzo T.

description:
Any stores in the Fishermans Wharf doesn't have to have a good service, does it?
No, they don't need to have.
That is a bottom line comment about service but when I saw an employee with the Chipotle uniform, who made my burrito, she was smoking right out side of the front door, disgusted me. Then, a Ninja kind of motorcycle drove by and parked right out side and the driver, an Asian guy, started to talk to the girl with Chipotle uniform, and smoking together, and he came in the store walk in to the kitchen area.

That's all I saw.
The food was Ok, but I lost my appetite when I saw her smoking.

But it means that there are 2 Chipotle employee at the location who smoke cigarette right out side of the store, was not a good view.

Smoke cigarette is very disgusting habit but not in Asia.

I think Fast Food restaurant manager doesn't have much control for employee's behavior.

I care about smoking issue.
It is difficult me to say because my parents both smoke cigarette but i don't.
I was a second hand smoker for many years.
I am glad I am away from them.

I don't say that cigarette smokers are bad person.
I just don't want to near them.

I still think smoke cigarette is very disgusting habit.
I am not going to change my mind even though my parents are smoker.
The bottom line is that I don't want to eat food made by a cigarette smoker.
But how can you know?
Yeah, that is a good question isn't it?
May be all Chinese, Japo, Korean chefs and cooks are all smoke cigarette. You never know.
I forgot to mention about French cook. Yeah, they all smoke, don't they?

I don't care they smoke or not but I just don't want to see it.
Is it too much to ask?

But do you care?
If you don't think it is disgusting, good for you!

But I saw the girl who just made my burrito, smoking out side, I really wish I didn't see it. that's all.

I wish I didn't see it.
I wish she smoke some where else, not right front of the store.
author: Nobu K.

description:
I am 100% Mexican, raised in a Mexican Household, identify as a Mexican and have eaten Mexican food my entire life. When i realized that the Game Store at the Wharf had been shut down and replaced by this new place, I figured I had to see what this new Chipotle craze was about since the one downtown was always packed.

So one day while debating between In N Out, Hooters, King of Thai, Subway, or Boudins, me and my girlfriend decided to check out Chipotle to try out the new spot. Being that I only am aware of traditional Mexican American spots with your typical burrito and taco orders along with dinner plates, Chipotle proved to be a refreshing new place.

When I first saw their menu and food options, I criticized them in my mind contemplating how they could have such few options and why it was all healthier than a typical Mexican spot in the mission. This was easily answered as its name Chipotle Mexican Grill is obviously misleading; however don't let this prevent you from giving it a try.

They offer your typical burrito, tacos, and quesadilla selections as would any restaurant with calorie information if you are watching your figure. What really intrigued me was the BURRITO BOWL!

The burrito bowl, basically the only thing I buy here, is a great creation. You start with your selection of cilantro-lime rice (yes, I too was surprised by the rice selection) or brown rice (evidence of healthy eating) and build your bowl by adding your choice of beans-pinto or black-followed by your choice of meat-carnitas, carne asada, chicken, etc. then you add your veggies, which include lettuce, guacamole (an additional $2.00), sour cream, then your choice of sauce (I always get the red sauce, beet part of this place), but their sauces are not hot/spicy at all and of course dont forget the cheese. I also buy a bag of Chips for $1.25 (yes, sadly Chips here aren't complimentary, not Mexican restaurant like at all) to accompany my eating of the burrito bowl.

I can keep on going with a detailed description of a burrito bowl but maybe it's best you try it for yourself. The burrito bowl is the only reason I would go to chipotle just to eat something different and because of this, it merits four stars in my opinion. 

But please, do not refer to it as a Mexican spot, because it's not; 100% American in my opinion. By the way, why do places continue to name their places foods that they don't even sell .e. Where the Chipotle at?
author: Jesus A.

description: Typical Chipotle chain location.  Not extra clean and doesn't have an on-site bathroom.
author: Chi T.

description:
I really don't have much to say about the quality of the food since it's about the same as any other chipotle, but the service here was terrible.  I know this is a relatively new branch of Chipotle, but they still don't seem to have it together.

we got coupons in the mail for buy one get one free burritos and free chips and guac with the purchase of the burrito, but it said on the coupon that you couldn't combine orders.  we definitely saw this but figured wed ask anyway.  we were told we could use both, but then when it came to checkout, we were then told we could only use one so we asked to use the buy one get one free coupons.  15 minutes later, they finally figured out how to give us one burrito for free, but still charged us for the chips and guac!  on top of that, they didnt even give us chips and guac...we had to ask like 5 times. 

ridiculous- worst experience ive ever had in chipotle.
author: Lisa C.

description:
First of all, I feel the customers about it being unorganized, it is. 
I quit that crazy job ! I worked there for a month and it was HELL! !!!
It is not the workers. The managers are unorganized because they all tell us different things. Food service is hard work and honestly they did not train us well at all so yeah we did not know what we were doing. I had to have a smile and be friendly when the kitchen manager was low key cussing us out every hour. Either way the customers were cool and friendly. F U Chipotle EVERY SINGLE DAY !! I'M GLAD THIS STORE IS FAILING !!! AND IS MAKING NO MONEY !!!
author: Jasmine L.

description:
LIZ WAS AWESOME!!!
I loved watching her handle my burrito.

Seriously though, the Whole staff was very friendly funny and a pleasure to be around. They were warm and exciting and enhanced the atmosphere during our meal. Excellent customer service.
author: Josh O.

description:
Horrible service! Is the owner trying to save money by not hiring employees who care?

The server actually chided me when I referred to the tomato salsa as "pico". Seriously? I don't care if you're not supposed to call it pico as you obviously knew what I was referring to.

Unless you're literally starving or have absolutely nowhere else to eat I cannot recommend going to this Chipotle.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I've ordered lunch online and picked it up at this location a handful of times. They always have the food ready to go, with a smile, and never forget anything. I really like the burrito bowl and get some of that yummy corn salsa on the side. Lunch for under $10 - can't beat that in this neighborhood. Also, this location is clean, and really nice on the inside.

This location has really friendly people behind the counter. I think they are working the kinks out a bit, but being nice goes a long way. 

TIP: Parking can be hard in this area, but if you have to drive bring someone with you to run in. If you pre-order & pay online they are super quick and you don't have to wait in the long ordering line.
author: Natalie N.

description:
It's a Chipotle and it's at Fisherman's Wharf.  Before coming here you should know what to expect.  Is it going to be the best Chipotle ever, probably not, but even a bad Chipotle is still pretty good.

When we came in the late evening, there wasn't much of a line and we were able to find some seats easily.  It was all pretty good and they even have a pretty good selection of beers.

If you're around Fisherman's Wharf and want a tasty burrito with that Chipotle style you're used to, this is a great place to stop by.  Only odd thing is I don't think we saw a restroom here.  Maybe they don't want tons of people stopping in just to use the restroom off the tourist area, or there is one in the back you need to ask about.  But just a bit odd.
author: Mark H.

description:
What? It's Chipotle. I like it. If you're looking for authentic Mexican food (or generally excellent service for that matter), get out of Fisherman's Wharf.

Extra points to this location for the (very despondent) dude who works there with all the howling wolf tattoos. That guy rules.
author: Sabrina V.

description:
Went 12-28-11. We were visiting San Fran for the first time and didn't want to spend big money on lunch. I love my local Chipotle here in WA, but this location was so bad I couldn't believe it. 

This is a busy location, I get that. But the employees were the worst in customer service that I have seen in a long time. They were so busy chatting, complaining about the management, checking cell phones, etc...that they couldn't be bothered with real customer service. They were the most unprofessional people I've ever seen. 

They were out of brown rice when we ordered, but not a huge deal. Well, then as we ate, they ran out of cilantro rice too. Likely because they were so disorganized. The restaurant was disgustingly dirty because not once did anyone come from behind the counter to wipe anything down. 

In short, glad I don't live here if this is the service I get.
author: Chris S.

description: Consistent inexpensive Mexican food; the restaurant uses fresh ingredients and classic culinary techniques.  Enjoy customized burritos, tacos, salads, chips & guacamole and more!
author: Tony S.

description: This place is just wrong. A disgrace to the fine cuisine of Mexico. After all, it is owned by McDonald's, so what did I expect?  I take responsibility on this one.
author: S. G.

description:
I was excited when I first heard that Chipotle would be opening close to my job. I went once... and now I'm not excited about it anymore.

There are a few things that bother me about Chipotle. 

1. No Chipotle sauce.  I asked for Chipotle sauce and I was told that they don't actually have any. I chose this restaurant based on the fact that it was named "CHIPOTLE" with the hopes that it would offer Chipotle sauce on their tacos. The Codmother next door has amazing fish tacos with a special creamy sauce. This establishment just offers the basics for a higher price.
2. No Shrimp or Fish tacos. I know I'm probably asking a lot but there are a lot of Mexican restaurants in the area with Camarones as an option in the Tacos and Burritos. I really love Shrimp.
3. No Olives - I realize this is more of a Puerto Rico/Spain thing. I just feel that if you can offer seasoned corn as a fillings option, you could throw some black olives into the mix too. 
4. $$Cost$$ - I figured since it is a major chain and it's offering just the basics, they could offer a better price as a motivation for customers to visit their restaurant over an authentic Mexican restaurant with more options. I was not impressed with the price or portion sizes. 

I had heard a lot of great things about Chipotle and I left feeling sorely disappointed by the experience. I don't understand the hype.
 
Note: I gave it two stars because the food was fresh enough. I did not have food poisoning or digestive problems after consuming the meal. The restaurant was relatively clean and watching the bush man scare the death out of wandering tourists while I ate my meal was amusing.
author: Daisy F.

description: the AC is blasted in this place & my burrito bowl got 2 cold 2 quick smh ;-( but besides that it's a friendly crew & shit whatever the chickens a lil salty but cooked perfectly & i kno...i work @ chipotle like a mile away....
author: Sophie Z.

description:
Slooooooooooooooooow. Slow, slow, slow. We waited in a line about three people deep and it took about 20 minutes to get our burritos, which had already gone cold by the time we were able to eat them. 

I watched the staff working while we waited and it seems like they haven't been trained to work efficiently. There was lots of disorganized running around, running to the back, disappearing for a bit, coming back to the front for more frantic running around. Yet, little was getting done.

If you come here, you best not be in any kind of hurry.
author: Heather T.

description: Went there around 7 pm, and they already locked up despite having hours posted online and on the door that they were open until 10 pm. Slackers :/
author: S C.

description: Horrible. I asked for less rice in my burrito bowl and the woman dumped it in then she game three small peppers. I told her to give me more veggies and she got pissed. She stormed off leaving me with no food. Someone had to fill in for her and he was even abrupt. I just wanted a high veggie low carb bowl. I should have just got a salad. Which by the way they should offer something other than watered down sour cream as a topping. Also no seating. You have to fight for it here.
author: Ashley W.

description:
Girl at the front of the assembly line didn't believe in putting anything on your burrito, so after you got a spoonful of rice and a spoonful of beans the guy at the end was there to give you a big fat burrito made mostly with cold sour cream, lettuce and guacamole. 

I went here 25% because I was hungry 75% because I wanted to go to the bathroom in this massive tourist trap with few bathrooms ... this Chipotle doesn't have a restroom you can use.
author: Saul C.

description:
what a disapointment!!!!!! i love chipotle, and I have been waiting forever for this location to open!!! i went in, the wait was sooo long, the longest I've ever waited, and the line wasn't even long. The employees had no idea what they were doing, how to portion the food properly, or even be nice. They were out of chicken and steak, and in the mean time, everyone was looking at eachother not knowing what to do... 

then time comes to cash out, and the cashier was rude as hell!! and no fishermans wharf 10% discount?! never again!
author: Gogo K.

description:
I came at 1115am, and it was greAt. Everything was clean, and I guess I was their second customer. I was help right away, and the guy seem happy and helpful. I'm happy about this location being so close to where I work . I'm also happy about the brown rice addition to the menu.
This is my third time here and I have nothing bad to say, only that if they get bussy, I don't think they have enough sits....
author: Karen P.

description:
need fast food on a road trip that is reasonable in price and healthy....we love this place...simple

the rest of the tourist food nearby....weak
author: Drew H.

description:
even though there's a line, the staff worked fairly quickly.
steak burrito was great! as good as i remembered it.
my only gripe - some of the steak pieces were very very chewy.

i tried the pork as well - i think the pork was too dry.
author: Sheren H.

description: Slow service for chipolte. Tables are dirty. The workers seem as though they are slammed, but aren't. Maybe this chipotle doesn't uphold the standards of some from Colorado chipotles. Not going back tho this one, also not a good impression for tourists.
author: Adam L.

description: The burrito is all rice.  The chips here are way over salted.  I have enough water retention.  My belly is constantly swollen.
author: Fatty A.

description: Cold horrible food. REALLY tall guy was totally uninterested in helping customers. Totally interested in pop celebs, talking bad about customers behind their back, talking about women rudely and loudly whistling.. I will never come back. Disgusting.
author: T W.

description: First of all I'm pretty sure this Chipolte does NOT close at 4 pm as listed as I just got back from eating there and it's 8pm on a Sunday. I thought the food was very good!  I had the steak bowl and it was fresh and tasted great. I'd definitely go back!
author: Jber G.

description: The worst Chipotle I've ever visited. The place was filthy and we couldn't find a clean place to sit. There was food all over the floor, and all of the tables needed to be wiped down. Also, the staff here acts like they are asleep. Very un-Chipotle-like. The girl who made my tacos smashed them together in the basket, which made them impossible to pick up. I was pissed off the entire meal. I expect more from Chipotle.
author: Brian C.

description:
YAY! More easy lunch/dinner options for people who work/live in the area. The decor is awesome/super clean, and the line goes pretty fast. 

Also, you can call in your order.
author: Leily P.

description:
Been waiting for this location to open since the only other one is downtown... woo hoo!

Super clean, fast service.  The employees were really nice (even when I heard the person next to me ask for all kinds of requests not on the menu - she basically turned her taco order into something completely different).

One bad thing (hence the 3 stars) - I came right after the lunch rush so got the bottom of the barrel chicken - a bit dry and not up to their usual standard.  But bad timing on my part.  

Heart Chipotle.  Will try again.
author: Anh D.

description: Typical Chipotle. You know what to expect and usually get it. They are generous with portions and will add more if you ask.
author: bruce f.

description:
So I love Chipotle.  Just love it.

These guys do not live up to the name.  They are slow.  The dining area is dirty (if you can manage to find a seat).  To top it off, the staff is frequently rude (or at least indifferent).

Even the burritos seem off (I eat a lot of Chipotle burritos).  I think it is the portion sizes for the ingredients.  The other stores seem to give more meat (not that I have ever measured).
author: Ted H.

description:
This isn't a Chipotle, it is an abortion of the Chipotle brand for all the same reasons my co-reviewers have pointed out.  Slow service, inconsistent portioning, pathetic presentation, and an indifferent cashier who took a 3 minute hiatus in the middle cashing me out to take a call on her cell phone.

Chipotle corporate should put a bullet in this franchise....
author: Mr. Papshmir ..

description:
I have been to this location several times before...but this time will be the last.

By far the smallest serving size of any Chipolte that I have ever been to...and I have been to a few.

It really doesn't help to have, what seemed like the shift manager talking to an employee that was eating on break saying, "I really need to get these serving sizes down."  WHILE, I was in line waiting...I thought she was joking but apparently not.  Just for reference I ordered a bowl and a burrito to go and both were the smallest I have ever had. 

I am not the type of person that likes to ask for more but, I should have known when the lady didn't charge me for the 10 cent bag.  The lady scoping the food never looked up at me because she would have seen the look on my face saying, "you can't be serious."

But wait it gets worse!  I guess no one orders brown rice as this location.  There were several bits of dried hard rice in the burrito when I finally got it home.  I would have brought it back but I was too far and too tired to fight over $7. 

There is a difference between having not enough water when cooking rice and rice drying out after cooking.  This was drying rice after cooking. Growing up Asian you quickly learn about left over rice.  You guys can slip this by some people but believe me, Asians may not know how to drive that well, but we know our rice.

Would have been zero star but that is not an option.
author: Ronald C.

description: There are not a whole lot of inexpensive options in fisherman's wharf when it comes to food. Basically, you have a few burger joints in the area and i wanted something different on the cheap. Ended up getting their burrito bowl for lunch and i don't know what the deal was but the server may have recognized me from dinner and gave me an overflowing bowl that i couldn't keep all the food in the bowl while i was eating may have got them more traffic while i was scarfing down the food in front of their street window
author: Ben H.

description: This place doesn't know their proportions!They basically give you a little bit of everything you want. The staff are rude and they don't make eye contact at all. It seems as if they hate their job. The place is a little messy and there is always a line. 15 minutes  the most waiting in line for your food.
author: Sally L.

description: I come here once in a while when I'm in the area and their burritos are just ok. The staff here is great, but their burritos are on the small size. I've to serveral other branches, but this one's tight with the meats! Just wish they're a bit generious, like the others.
author: Larry F.

description: Worst Mexican I have ever had in my life! How do you mess up a steak burrito so badly?? With so many good cheap taco/burrito places in SF there is no reason to go here. I have been to other chipotle locations and remember thinking it was good. Other reviews have said the same thing, that this particular location just isn't good.   Most of the people that gave it a good review, just look where they are from, places that don't even know what mexican food is. The staff was friendly but Bottom line it tasted terrible and cost $12 for a burrito!
author: Vince C.

description: I love Chipotle. This one is well placed, and the staff were very friendly. The manager even walked rough the tables and made sure everyone was enjoying their meals.
author: Hugo B.

description:
After eating at a chipotle restaurant somewhere between LA and San Diego, I became a fan of their burritos.  All of us LOVE chipotle burritos, including my 2 year old daughter.

This restaurant is probably not their best outlets but still it is awesome!!  There are some new people at work here I guess, so sometimes the burrito is smaller than its usual size or not wrapped well.  But still their burritos are awesome, so it gets 5 stars.
author: Viji K.

description: With so many great locally owned taquerias in SF, why go to Chipotle... Well if you're like me and accidentally found yourself in Touristman's  Warf surrounded by only chain restaurants, Chipotle is a pretty good option.  overall: Simple yet customizable menu, fresh ingredients and clean.
author: J D.

description: I usually get a quesarito when I come to chipotle, and recently I have been disappointed. This one was especially good though, they didn't overcook the tortilla when melting the cheese. A lot of places do.
author: Evan D.

description: Stormy that helped us out, was so incredibly friendly and personable that I know she has got a bright future.   I will be back because of her.
author: Daniel A.

description: We eat at Chipotle in Paradise Valley, AZ ALL THE TIME and they are amazing! The service and attitude at this location left a lot to be desired--and, frankly, the restaurant is really dirty. Tables needed to be bussed and the serving area was also very unclean looking. Finally, we have severe food allergies and when I told them this, they looked at me like I had two heads. With only one exception, the locations we have gone to are so well-trained on allergies. NOT this one. And, the manager of this location just stood around and ordered everyone else to do the work. Managers at other locations are totally engaged with the customers and the tasks that need to be done. Totally unimpressed with this location and not surprised by how UNcrowded it was.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Ah, a burrito that actually contains fresh vegetables and doesn't make my stomach hurt afterwards... (No offense to the mission, but uugh.)

I love you chipotle. You make my belly happy. And my wallet too- especially in hypertouristy fisherman's wharf.
author: L B.

description: Food as usual at Chipotle is great but the service here is terrible.  Painfully slow lines with workers who do not seem to know the Chipotle way of moving people through a line.
author: Dan W.

description: Food was good enough but I had to clean the table myself because it was very wet from when they had cleared it. I had to use 3 napkins. Not very professional.
author: Gustavo M.

description: Food was actually okay, but this location is too small without enough seats.  They need to make better use of the limited space they have here.  Nothing beats trying to enjoy your burrito bowl while everybody else is wandering around waiting for you to finish so that they can grab your seat, all of the various tray and burrito carrying customers making a mad dash towards you every time your legs flinch.
author: Alan M.

description:
WTF!?!? Chipolte, I want a massive burrito BRO! 

some guy always asks me if I want a burrito I say yes then he says NOPE!, funny w/e brah its cool. BUT HE PINS ME ON THE BURRITO its so small barely any rice and NO MEAT. seriously.....


any other one packs on a great burrito but these guys skim and it sucks. I work really close and if i did not get small burrito for 7$ every time I would honestly go everyday.

basically I only go to this chipolte if I see the right person working and even then its just an avergae burrito, NOT like the one downtown or in CHICO, CA i use to go to, those guys know how to make it.



BRB staff here go learn how to do it right
author: Jon L.

description: We've ordered for take out a few times with ok results.  Unless you are standing there watching them make it it seems they miss something in at least 1 item.  Plus I hate the fact that they do not distribute the ingredients well enough in the burritos...I do not want a full mouth of guac in one bite.  So if you go, watch them make your order. If not, check it before you leave.
author: Diana L.

description: This place was HORRIBLE!!!! We were VERY disappointed & frustrated by this place.,  They had NO BEANS & NO DRINKS! What mexican place has NO BEANS?!?! They didn't apologize or try to at least compensate, they filled meat burritos with rice & barely put any meat on it. They chinsed on the kids meal, apparently it was supposed to come with beans, rice & chips, they only gave us the quesadilla & drink. We ordered chips & salsa, they gave us a handful of chips & filled the salsa halfway. The staff all seemed very put out & were not only un-friendly but were rude! I will NEVER come here again!
author: Traci C.

description: I love Chipotle, but this location is not good.  The food is great, but the service and the presentation is weak at best.  Been here 3 times while I have been in town and all 3 have been the same.  I will be back at Chipotle, but not this location.
author: Stephen J.

description: For better or worse....I eat at a Chipotle once or twice a month when I'm traveling  in San Jose, Sacramento, Fresno, etc..   They're almost always really good.   I went to the one @ Fisherman's Wharf which is kind of by my house (they offered a coupon) and it sucked.   Burrito was cold on the inside and mediocre tasting.
author: S W.

description: Service was less than desirable. Most workers did not want to be there, and it showed. Food the same as other Chipolte's.
author: Gene S.

description: need to give fisherman wharf discount, i work down there and i would go there like 5x a week if they had it, and tell others to eat there.
author: Kenneth G.

description: In a sea of corporate food this is one of the better ones down here.
author: Theresa R.
